purpose: To explain how propensity models help issuers enhance marketing efforts and connect messages with cardholders.
title: Propensity Models: Propensity Models Help Issuers to Enhance their Marketing Efforts and Connect the Right Messages with the Right Cardholders
reasoning_strategy: Illustration of the process from issuer card portfolio to marketing population using propensity models.

content_zones.left: Infographic showing the process of scoring from issuer card portfolio to marketing.
content_zones.right: Table explaining different models and their descriptions.

cells: Spend Attrition
Identifies recently-active accounts likely to become inactive in the next 3 months
Recurring Payments
Identifies accounts likely to begin a recurring payments relationship with a merchant in the next 3 months
Small Business
Identifies consumer accounts with spending profiles that most resemble those of known small business accounts
Ecommerce
Estimates likelihood of spending online in any category in the next 3 months
Early Months on Book (EMOB)
Estimates the number of transactions expected to occur for each new account (active less than six months) in the next 6 months
Reactivation
Indicates the likelihood that accounts with short term inactivity will spontaneously reactivate in the next 3 months
Overall Card Usage
Estimates the number of transactions expected to occur for each established account (active more than six months) in the next 6 months
Category Expansion
Estimates likelihood of first-time spending in an industry category in the next 6 months
Category Spend
Estimates cardholder spending in an industry category in the next 6 months
Cross Border
Estimates the likelihood of cardholders spending abroad.
Card On File
Estimates the likelihood of a cardholder begin a recurring payment or card-on-file relationship
Mobile Payments
Identifies the likelihood that an account holder will use a mobile payment service when making a payment, such as MDES, Paypal, or Venmo
Advanced Buyer Segments
Classification of each account into one of 24 Advanced Buyer Segments.
Card Usage Segmentation
Identify likely wallet position and degree of cardholder engagement.
Regional Travel Models
Identifies the likelihood that an account holder will travel to specific regions.
